messages.message:
Hey team, @vineeth and I noticed one small bug while trying to check the release version on dogfood.instabase.com (http://dogfood.instabase.com): Whenever we check release version from an app (text-editor, flow, etc) - basically any url that starts with https://dogfood.instabase.com/apps/ - we see a blank value in place of the release version in the pop-up box.

This works fine when checking the release version from explorer normally.

This might be a deployment thing specific to dogfood - it's working fine on uat.dogfood. The environment variables this comes from are not being set. Maybe @kunal? One example of the environment variables that are empty is RELEASE_VERSION

I think these env variables like `RELEASE_VERSION` are only set for actual releases, so this feature will work in any environment deployed on a specific release.

This feature won’t work on dogfood though since it’s deployed on master, which I think makes sense because there’s no actual release version for dogfood
That doesn't quite explain why it shows up in pages served by webapp and not those served by apps-server :thinking_face:
ah you’re right, `RELEASE_VERSION` is actually set on all branches, not just release branches

Ah yeah — this is missing on apps-server, got removed during the control plane migration. This PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/23932/files#diff-220aef310467211856592ad6f0ba73dba6f3ba4a60214bacfc90f8b17b61704aR307) adds it back though.
